tree.content:
My name is ~~Inigo Montoya~~ Wolfram and I am a multi disciplinary web developer and experience designer. My specialty is in front-end development and designing new or uncommon interactions. In my spare time, I like to theorycraft, take things apart, and sometimes put them back together.

I am currently freelancing. You can find me in ~~NYC~~ ~~Atlanta~~ Chicago.
A design bootcamp located in Chicago that specializes in UI/UX education. I worked on both internal and public-facing projects as well as acted as the dev and UX mentor for the students.
Initiative that focuses on pairing grade school students with learning opportunities that help develop their interests. Worked with the designers to refine the designs and eventually code the pages.
A community events calendar for all things design in the Chicagoland area, created for AIGA and DESIGNATION. Designed by Molly Lester.
E-commerce site to buy local products from small and artisan stores. Responsible for front-end.
Site is [viewable](http://piecesofthere.com) but no longer active.
Marketing page for a startup creating a brand new way for people to take care of their skin.
Self-initiated project: music visualizer built with PaperJS. Allows the user to upload his or her own .mp3 files as well.
SAIC | Service design project for SAIC's Continuing Studies program involving student aquisition and retention.
Erasing the Distance | Service design project for a NPO raising social awareness of mental illness. Project was primarily focused on making internal financial processes more efficient.
Campfires.io | Design blog that publishes weekly interviews with notable people in the design world and gives a glimpse into each designer's method to his or her madness.
